It does, for a single `JointPosition` in this case. But multiple `JointPosition` components may not be stored adjacent to each other because they belong to different `std::vector` objects.

@chapulina Two questions:

* Are we okay with fixing the number of axes? We do have some joints that have 3 DOF and @mxgrey [mentioned](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/254/acropolis-add-applyjointforce-system/activity#comment-97872127) possible custom joints.
* Do we want to put it on the user to know which axes are valid based on the joint type?
